title: Bert Gordon (rugby league)
text:
Bert Gordon is an Australian former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s.
After representing N.S.W. Country Firsts in 1986, Bert Gordon was offered a two-year contract with <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George Dragons</a>. He played two seasons with the club between 1987 and 1988, and is best remembered for an amazing intercept try that he scored in the final of the <a href="1988%20Panasonic%20Cup">1988 Panasonic Cup</a> midweek competition that helped to give <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George Dragons</a> a hard-fought victory. He retired from first grade rugby league at the end of the <a href="1988%20NSWRL%20season">1988 NSWRL season</a>. Bert Gordon finished his rugby league career at <a href="Cowra%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Cowra, New South Wales</a> where he led the local rugby league team Cowra Magpies to a premiership victory in 1995.
